section.title: Environment
section.para: In order to use Pegasus, you will have to set the PEGASUS_HOME environment variable, and source the Pegasus setup script.

note.para: Pegasus 3.0 has partial support for running without PEGASUS_HOME being defined. This feature is still being tested, so to be on the safe side, continue setting PEGASUS_HOME.
This document assumes you are using a Bourne Shell derived shell. e.g. /bin/sh or /bin/bash. csh setup scripts are available with the .csh extension.

section.para: Set up the PEGASUS user environment$ . $PEGASUS_HOME/setup.sh

section.title: Native Packages (RPM/DEB)
section.para: The preferred way to install Pegasus is with native (RPM/DEB) packages. Using this packages, Pegasus will be installed into /opt/pegasus/{major_version}.{minor_version}, and the packages have {major_version}.{minor_version} in the package name. section.title: Pegasus from Tarballs
section.para: The Pegaus prebuild tarballs can be downloaded from the download page.

section.title: Tarball without Condor
section.para: Use these tarballs if you already have Condor installed or prefer to keep the Condor installation separate from the Pegasus installation.

listitem.para: Untar the tarball
set environment PEGASUS_HOME to the directory pegasus-3.0.0
$ setenv PEGASUS_HOME /path/to/pegasus-3.0.0or in bash$ export PEGASUS_HOME=/path/to/pegasus-3.0.0
Source the setup scripts setup.sh for BASH or setup.csh for CSH/TCSH
$ source setup.cshor in bash

section.title: Tarball with Included Condor
section.para: For convenience, there is Pegasus WMS tarballs which has Condor included. This way you can instlal Pegasus and Condor at the same time, with just minor configuration to get up and running.

listitem.para: Untar the tarball
set environment PEGASUS_HOME to the directory pegasus-wms-3.0.0
$ setenv PEGASUS_HOME /path/to/pegasus-wms-3.0.0or in bash$ export PEGASUS_HOME=/path/to/pegasus-wms-3.0.0
Source the setup scripts setup.sh for BASH or setup.csh for CSH/TCSH
$ source setup.cshor in bash

Edit the Condor Configuration file. The configuration file is currently configured to run only as a submit side (Runs schedd) supporting schedule, local and grid universe. If you want to use it for gt4, lsf, pbs or condor-c additional configuration changes may be required. Please check the Condor Manual for appropriate parameters.

For now you need to change only 2 parameters. Change !!PEGASUS_HOME!! to the actual path where PEGASUS_WMS is installed and CHANGE !!USER!! to the user who will receive email in case of error. (This can generally be just your username )

para.programlisting:
$ vim $PEGASUS_HOME/etc/condor_config
RELEASE_DIR = !!PEGASUS_HOME!! # CHANGE THIS TO PATH OF PEGASUS_WMS INSTALLATION
CONDOR_ADMIN = !!USER!! # CHANGE THIS To THE USER WHO wILL GET EMAIL INCASE OF ERROR.

listitem.para: Start Condor by running $PEGASUS_HOME/sbin/condor_master
Check if condor is up by running the condor_q command

para.programlisting:
$ condor_q
